DOCNAME: CASE OF REFAH PARTISI (THE WELFARE PARTY) AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association (Article 11-1 - Freedom of association)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant , PERSON ( ORG – “ LOC ) , was a political party founded on DATE . It was represented by its chairman , Mr PERSON , who is also the second applicant . He was born in DATE and lives in GPE . An engineer by training , he is a politician . At the material time he was a member of ORG and PERCENT ’s chairman .

The third applicant , Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE , lives in GPE . He is a politician and a lawyer . At the material time he was a member of ORG and a vice - chairman of ORG . The fourth applicant , Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE , lives in GPE . He is a politician and a lawyer . At the material time he was a member of ORG and a vice - chairman of ORG .

CARDINAL . Refah took part in a number of general and local elections . In the local elections in DATE PERSON obtained PERCENT of the votes and its candidates were elected mayor in a number of towns , including CARDINAL large cities . In the general election of DATE it obtained PERCENT of the votes . The CARDINAL MPs elected as a result took part DATE in the work of ORG and its various committees , including ORG , which proposed amendments to LAW that became law on DATE . During the debate in ORG on the new sixth paragraph of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) the chairman of ORG explained when he presented the draft it had prepared that ORG would not restrict itself to noting the unconstitutional nature of the individual acts of the members of a party but would then be obliged to declare that the party concerned had become a centre of anticonstitutional activities on account of those acts . CARDINAL MP , representing the parliamentary group of ORG , emphasised the need to change the relevant provisions of PERSON no . PERSON on the regulation of political parties to take account of the new sixth paragraph of LAW .
Ultimately , PERSON obtained PERCENT of the votes in the general election of DATE and PERCENT of the votes in the local elections of DATE .

The results of the DATE general election made LOC largest political party in GPE with a total of CARDINAL seats in ORG ( which had CARDINAL members at the material time ) . On DATE Refah came to power by forming a coalition government with the centre - right ORG ( PERSON ) , led by PERSON . According to an opinion poll carried out in DATE , if a general election had been held at that time , PERSON would have obtained PERCENT of the votes . The same poll predicted that ORG might obtain PERCENT of the votes in the general election to be held DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG at ORG applied to ORG to have PERSON dissolved on the grounds that it was a “ centre ” ( mihrak ) of activities contrary to the principles of secularism . In support of his application , he referred to the following acts and remarks by certain leaders and members of GPE .

– Whenever they spoke in public PERSON ’s chairman and other leaders advocated the wearing of NORP headscarves in ORG schools and buildings occupied by public administrative authorities , whereas ORG had already ruled that this infringed the principle of secularism enshrined in LAW .

– At a meeting on constitutional reform PERSON ’s chairman , Mr ORG , had made proposals tending towards the abolition of secularism in GPE . He had suggested that the adherents of each religious movement should obey their own rules rather than the rules of NORP law .

– On DATE Mr ORG had asked ORG representatives in ORG to consider whether the change in the social order which the party sought would be “ peaceful or violent ” and would be achieved “ harmoniously or by bloodshed ” .

– At a seminar held in DATE in GPE , Mr ORG had called on NORP to join GPE , saying that only his party could establish the supremacy of the Koran through a holy war ( jihad ) and that NORP should therefore make donations to GPE rather than distributing alms to third parties .
– During DATE Mr NORP had received the heads of the NORP movements at the residence reserved for the Prime Minister , thus assuring them of his support .

– Several members of GPE , including some in high office , had made speeches calling for the secular political system to be replaced by a theocratic system . These persons had also advocated the elimination of the opponents of this policy , if necessary by force . PERSON , by refusing to open disciplinary proceedings against the members concerned and even , in certain cases , facilitating the dissemination of their speeches , had tacitly approved the views expressed .

– On DATE a Refah MP , Mr PERSON , had said in front of journalists in the corridors of the parliament building that blood would flow if an attempt was made to close the “ PERSON - Hatip ” theological colleges , that the situation might become worse than in GPE , that he personally wanted blood to flow so that democracy could be installed in the country , that he would strike back against anyone who attacked him and that he would fight to the end for the introduction of NORP law ( sharia ) .

– The Minister of ORG , Mr PERSON ( a Refah MP and vice - chairman of the party ) , had expressed his support for the mayor of NORP by visiting him in the prison where he had been detained pending trial after being charged with publicly vindicating international NORP terrorist groups .
ORG further observed that Refah had not opened any disciplinary proceedings against those responsible for the above - mentioned acts and remarks .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted new evidence against FAC to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG representatives filed their defence submissions , in which they relied on international human - rights protection instruments , including the Convention , pointing out that these instruments formed part of NORP written law . They further referred to the case - law of the Commission , which had expressed the opinion that LAW had been breached in the cases concerning ORG of GPE and ORG , and to the case - law of ORG on the restrictions on freedom of expression and freedom of association authorised by the second paragraphs of ORG CARDINAL of the Convention . They contended that the dissolution of GPE was not prompted by a pressing social need and was not necessary in a NORP society . Nor , according to ORG representatives , was their party ’s dissolution justified by application of the “ clear and present danger ” test laid down by ORG .

CARDINAL . Refah ’s representatives further rejected ORG argument that the party was a “ centre ” of activities which undermined the secular nature of the Republic . They submitted that PERSON was not caught by the criteria laid down in the PERSON on the regulation of political parties for determining whether a political party constituted a “ centre of anticonstitutional activities ” . They observed , inter alia , that the prosecuting authorities had not issued any warning to PERSON ( which had CARDINAL members ) that might have enabled it to expel any of its members whose acts had contravened the provisions of LAW .

CARDINAL . Refah ’s representatives also set out their point of view on the concept of secularism . They asserted that the principle of secularism implied respect for all beliefs and that LOC had shown such respect in its political activity .

CARDINAL . NORP The ORG representatives alleged that in accusing Mr ORG of supporting the use of force to achieve political ends and of infringing the principle of secularism the prosecuting authorities had merely cited extracts from his speeches which they had distorted and taken out of context . Moreover , these remarks were covered by PERSON ORG parliamentary immunity . They further noted that the dinner he had given to senior officials of ORG and former members of the theology faculty had been presented by ORG as a reception organised for the leaders of NORP fundamentalist movements , which had in any event been legally proscribed since DATE .
CARDINAL . With regard to the remarks of the other NORP leaders and members criticised by ORG , ORG representatives observed that these did not constitute any criminal offence .

They asserted that none of the MPs whose speeches had been referred to by ORG was authorised to represent PERSON or held office within the party and claimed that the prosecuting authorities had not set in motion the procedure laid down in the PERSON on the regulation of political parties so as to give LOC the opportunity , if the need arose , to decide whether or not the persons concerned should continue to be members of the party ; the first time Refah ’s leadership had been informed of the remarks criticised in the case had been when they read ORG submissions . The CARDINAL MPs under attack had been expelled from the party , which had thus done what was necessary to avoid becoming a “ centre ” of illegal activities within the meaning of the PERSON on the regulation of political parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed his observations on the merits of the case with ORG . He submitted that according to the LAW and the case - law of the NORP courts on constitutional - law issues nothing obliged GPE to tolerate the existence of political parties that sought the destruction of democracy and the rule of law . He contended that ORG , by describing itself as an army engaged in a jihad and by openly declaring its intention to replace the Republic ’s statute law by sharia , had demonstrated that its objectives were incompatible with the requirements of a democratic society . PERSON ’s aim to establish a plurality of legal systems ( in which each group would be governed by a legal system in conformity with its members’ religious beliefs ) constituted the first stage in the process designed to substitute a theocratic regime for the Republic .

CARDINAL . In their observations on the merits of the case , ORG representatives again argued that the dissolution of their party could not be grounded on any of the restrictions permitted by the second paragraph of LAW . They went on to say that LAW was not applicable in the case , as Refah had nothing in common with political parties which sought to install a totalitarian regime . Furthermore , the plurality of legal systems which their party proposed was actually intended to promote the freedom to enter into contracts and the freedom to choose which court should have jurisdiction .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted his observations orally . On CARDINAL and DATE Mr PERSON submitted his oral observations on behalf of Refah .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , which it delivered following proceedings on preliminary issues it had instituted of its own motion as the court dealing with the merits , ORG ruled that , regard being had to LAW , the second paragraph of LAW on the regulation of political parties was unconstitutional and declared it null and void . LAW , taken together with section ORG ) of the same PERSON , provided that for a political party to be considered a “ centre ” of activities contrary to the fundamental principles of the Republic its members had to have been convicted of criminal offences . According to ORG , that legal restriction did not cover all cases where the principles of the Republic had been flouted . It pointed out , among other observations , that after the repeal of LAW activities contrary to the principle of secularism no longer attracted criminal penalties .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dissolved Refah on the ground that it had become a “ centre of activities contrary to the principle of secularism ” . It based its decision on sections FAC ) and CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . FAC on the regulation of political parties . It also noted the transfer of Refah ’s assets to the ORG as an automatic consequence of dissolution , in accordance with LAW no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . NORP In its judgment ORG first dismissed the preliminary objections raised by GPE . In that connection it held that the parliamentary immunity of the MPs whose remarks had been mentioned in ORG submissions of CARDINAL DATE had nothing to do with consideration of an application for the dissolution of a political party and forfeiture of political rights by its members , but was a question of the criminal responsibility of the MPs concerned , which was not a matter of constitutional law .

CARDINAL . With regard to the merits , ORG held that while political parties were the main protagonists of democratic politics their activities were not exempt from certain restrictions . In particular , activities by them incompatible with the rule of law could not be tolerated . ORG referred to the provisions of the LAW which imposed respect for secularism on the various organs of political power . It also cited the numerous provisions of domestic legislation requiring political parties to apply the principle of secularism in a number of fields of political and social life . ORG observed that secularism was CARDINAL of the indispensable conditions of democracy . In GPE the principle of secularism was safeguarded by the LAW , on account of the country ’s historical experience and the specific features of ORG . The rules of sharia were incompatible with the democratic regime . The principle of secularism prevented the ORG from manifesting a preference for a particular religion or belief and constituted the foundation of freedom of conscience and equality between citizens before the law . Intervention by the ORG to preserve the secular nature of the political regime had to be considered necessary in a NORP society .
CARDINAL . ORG held that the following evidence proved that PERSON had become a centre of activities contrary to the principle of secularism ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) :

CARDINAL . Refah ’s chairman , Mr PERSON , had encouraged the wearing of NORP headscarves in public and educational establishments . On DATE , at the party ’s Fourth Ordinary General Meeting , he had said :

“ ... when we were in government , for DATE , the notorious LAW was never applied against any child in the country . In our time there was never any question of hostility to the wearing of headscarves ... ”
In his speech of DATE before the general election he had said :
“ ... [ university ] chancellors are going to retreat before the headscarf when PERSON comes to power . ”

But manifesting one ’s religion in such a manner amounted to exerting pressure on persons who did not follow that practice and created discrimination on the ground of religion or beliefs . That finding was supported by various rulings of ORG and ORG and by the case - law of ORG on applications nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL concerning the wearing of headscarves at universities .

CARDINAL . The plurality of legal systems proposed by Mr Necmettin Erbakan was nothing to do with the freedom to enter into contracts as LOC claimed , but was an attempt to establish a distinction between citizens on the ground of their religion and beliefs and was aimed at the installation of a theocratic regime . On DATE Mr Erbakan had made the following speech to ORG :

“ ... ‘ you shall live in a manner compatible with your beliefs’ . We want despotism to be abolished . There must be several legal systems . The citizen must be able to choose for himself which legal system is most appropriate for him , within a framework of general principles . Moreover , that has always been the case throughout our history . In our history there have been various religious movements . Everyone lived according to the legal rules of his own organisation , and so everyone lived in peace . Why , then , should I be obliged to live according to another ’s rules ? ... The right to choose one ’s own legal system is an integral part of the freedom of religion . ”
In addition , Mr ORG had spoken as follows on DATE at a FAC party conference :

“ ... we shall guarantee all human rights . We shall guarantee to everyone the right to live as he sees fit and to choose the legal system he prefers . We shall free the administration from centralism . The ORG which you have installed is a repressive ORG , not a ORG at the people ’s service . You do not allow the freedom to choose one ’s code of law . When we are in power a NORP will be able to get married before the mufti , if he wishes , and a NORP will be able to marry in church , if he prefers . ”

CARDINAL . The plurality of legal systems advocated by Mr Necmettin Erbakan in his speeches had its origin in the practice introduced in DATE of ORG by the “ GPE ” , which had given the NORP and polytheist communities the right to live according to their own legal systems , not according to NORP law . On the basis of ORG some NORP thinkers and politicians had proposed a model of peaceful social co - existence under which each religious group would be free to choose its own legal system . Since the foundation of ORG in DATE ( dissolved by a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ) Mr PERSON had been seeking to replace the single legal system with a plurality of legal systems .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court further observed that in a plurality of legal systems , as proposed by ORG , society would have to be divided into several religious movements ; each individual would have to choose the movement to which he wished to belong and would thus be subjected to the rights and obligations prescribed by the religion of his community . ORG pointed out that such a system , whose origins lay in the history of ORG as a political regime , was inimical to the consciousness of allegiance to a nation having legislative and judicial unity . It would naturally impair judicial unity since each religious movement would set up its own courts and the ordinary courts would be obliged to apply the law according to the religion of those appearing before them , thus obliging the latter to reveal their beliefs . It would also undermine legislative and judicial unity , the preconditions for secularism and the consciousness of nationhood , given that each religious movement would be empowered to decree what legal rules should be applicable to its members .
CARDINAL . In addition , Mr ORG had made a speech on DATE to the FAC group in ORG in which he had advocated setting up a theocratic regime , if necessary through force :

“ The second important point is this : PERSON will come to power and a just [ social ] order [ adil CARDINAL ] will be established . The question we must ask ourselves is whether this change will be violent or peaceful ; whether it will entail bloodshed . I would have preferred not to have to use those terms , but in the face of all that , in the face of terrorism , and so that everyone can see the true situation clearly , I feel obliged to do so . DATE GPE must take a decision . ORG will establish a just order , that is certain . [ But ] will the transition be peaceful or violent ; will it be achieved harmoniously or by bloodshed ? The CARDINAL [ citizens ] must make up their minds on that point . ”

CARDINAL . The reception given by Mr Necmettin Erbakan at the Prime Minister ’s residence to the leaders of various religious movements , who had attended in vestments denoting their religious allegiance , unambiguously evidenced ORG ’s chairman ’s support for these religious groups vis - à - vis public opinion .

CARDINAL . In a public speech in DATE Mr PERSON , MP for the province of PERSON , had issued a clear call to wage a jihad and had argued for the introduction of NORP law , making the following declaration :
“ We shall certainly call to account those who turn their backs on the precepts of the Koran and those who deprive Allah ’s Messenger of his jurisdiction in their country . ”
In another public speech , also in DATE , Mr PERSON had said :

“ In the hereafter you will be summoned with the leaders you have chosen in this life . ... Have you considered to what extent the Koran is applied in this country ? I have done the sums . PERCENT [ of the rules ] in the Koran are applied in this country . CARDINAL verses have been quietly forgotten ... You found a ORG , you build a hostel , you pay for a child ’s education , you teach , you preach . ... None of that is part of the chapter on jihad but of that on the amel - i salih [ peacetime activities ] . Jihad is the name given to the quest for power for the advent of justice , for the propagation of justice and for glorification of ORG ’s Word . Allah did not see that task as an abstract political concept ; he made it a requirement for warriors [ cahudi ] . What does that mean ? That jihad must be waged by an army ! The commander is identified ... The condition to be met before prayer [ namaz ] is the NORP of power . Allah says that , before FAC , it is the path of power which must be NORP ... It is not erecting vaulted ceilings in the places of prayer which will lead you to LOC . For Allah does not ask whether you have built up vaulted ceilings in this country . He will not ask that . He will ask you if you have reached a sufficient level ... DATE , if NORP have MONEY , they must give CARDINAL to the Koranic schools , to train our children , girls and boys , and CARDINAL must be given to the political establishments which open the road to power . Allah asked all His prophets to fight for power . You can not name a single member of a religious movement who does not fight for power . I tell you , if I had as many heads as I have hairs on my head , even if each of those heads were to be torn from my shoulders for following the way of the Koran , I would not abandon my cause ... The question Allah will ask you is this : ‘ Why , in the time of the blasphemous regime , did you not work for the construction of an NORP ORG and his friends want to bring ORG to this country in the form of a political party . The prosecutor understood that clearly . If we could understand that as he did , the problem would be solved . Even PERSON the NORP has realised that in this country the symbol of NORP is PERSON . He who incites the NORP community [ cemaat ] to take up arms before political power is in NORP hands is a fool , or a traitor doing the bidding of others . For none of the prophets authorised war before the capture of State power . ... NORP are intelligent . They do not reveal how they intend to beat their enemy . The general staff gives orders and the soldiers obey . If the general staff reveals its plan , it is up to the commanders of the NORP community to make a new plan . Our mission is not to talk , but to apply the war plan , as soldiers in the army ... ”

Criminal proceedings had been brought against Mr PERSON . Although his antipathy to secularism was well - known , PERSON had adopted him as a candidate in local - government elections . After he had been elected mayor of LAW had made sure that he was elected as an MP in ORG .

CARDINAL . In a public speech on DATE and a television interview first recorded in DATE and rebroadcast on DATE , Mr PERSON , PERSON for the province of GPE , had encouraged discrimination between believers and non - believers and had predicted that if the supporters of applying sharia came to power they would annihilate nonbelievers :

“ Our homeland belongs to us , but not the regime , dear brothers . The regime and Kemalism belong to others . ... GPE will be destroyed , gentlemen . People say : Could GPE become like GPE ? Just as , in GPE , we got PERCENT [ of the votes ] , here too we will reach PERCENT , we will not remain on PERCENT . Do not waste your energy on us – I am speaking here to you , to those ... of the imperialist LOC , the colonising LOC , the wild LOC , to those who , in order to unite with the rest of the world , become the enemies of honour and modesty , those who lower themselves to the level of dogs , of puppies , in order to imitate the LOC , to the extent of putting dogs between the legs of NORP women – it is to you I speak when I say : ‘ Do not waste your energy on us , you will die at the hands of the people of PERSON ”

“ ... the army says : ‘ We can accept it if you ’re a supporter of the ORG , but a supporter of sharia , never.’ Well you wo n’t solve the problem with that attitude . If you want the solution , it ’s sharia . ”
ORG had ensured that PERSON was elected as an MP and its local branches had played videotapes of this speech and the interview .

CARDINAL . Refah ’s vice - chairman , Mr PERSON , in a speech he made in DATE while on pilgrimage in GPE which was shown by a NORP television station , had said that he advocated installing a regime based on sharia :

“ In countries which have a parliamentary regime , if the people are not sufficiently aware , if they do not work hard enough to bring about the advent of ‘ ORG nizami’ [ a just order or PERSON ’s order ] , CARDINAL calamities lie ahead . The first calamity is the renegades they will have to face . They will be tyrannised by them and will eventually disappear . The second calamity is that they will not be able to give a satisfactory account of themselves to Allah , as they will not have worked to establish ‘ ORG nizami’ . And so they will likewise perish . Venerable brothers , our duty is to do what is necessary to introduce the system of justice , taking these subtleties into consideration . The political apparatus which seeks to establish ‘ ORG in GPE is ORG . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the mayor of GPE , Mr PERSON , had urged the population to renounce secularism and asked his audience to “ keep their hatred alive ” until the regime was changed , in the following terms :

“ The dominant forces say ‘ either you live as we do or we will sow discord and corruption among you’ . So even ORG dare not reveal their world - outlook inside their ORG . TIME I too attended a ceremony in my official capacity . When you see me dressed up like this in all this finery , do n’t think it ’s because I ’m a supporter of secularism . In this period when our beliefs are not respected , and indeed are blasphemed against , I have had to attend these ceremonies in spite of myself . The Prime Minister , other Ministers and MPs have certain obligations . But you have no obligations . This system must change . We have waited , we will wait a little longer . Let us see what the future has in store for us . And let NORP keep alive the resentment , rancour and hatred they feel in their hearts . ”
Mr PERSON had been convicted of inciting the people to hatred on the ground of religion .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON , PERSON for the province of ORG , had spoken in ORG in favour of the establishment of a regime based on sharia and approving acts of violence like those which were taking place in GPE :

“ If you attempt to close down the ‘ ORG theological colleges while ORG is in government , blood will flow . It would be worse than in GPE . I too would like blood to flow . That ’s how democracy will be installed . And it will be a beautiful thing . The army has not been able to deal with QUANTITY members of the ORG . How would it see off CARDINAL NORP ? If they piss into the wind they ’ll get their faces wet . If anyone attacks me I will strike back . I will fight to the end to introduce sharia . ”
Mr PERSON had been expelled from the party DATE after the application for dissolution had been lodged . His exclusion had probably only been an attempt to evade the penalty in question .

CARDINAL . Refah ’s vice - chairman , the Minister of ORG , Mr PERSON , had visited a person detained pending trial for activities contrary to the principle of secularism , thus publicly lending him his support as a Minister .
CARDINAL . On the basis of the evidence adduced on DATE by ORG , ORG held that the following further evidence confirmed that Refah was a centre of activities contrary to the principle of secularism :
– In a public speech on DATE Mr PERSON had emphasised the importance of television as an instrument of propaganda in the holy war being waged in order to establish NORP order :

“ ... A ORG without television is not a ORG . If DATE , with your leadership , you wished to create a ORG , if you wanted to set up a television station , you would not even be able to broadcast for CARDINAL . Do you believe it is as easy as that to create a ORG ? That ’s what I told them DATE . I remember it now . Because DATE people who have beliefs , an audience and a certain vision of the world , have a television station of their own , thanks be to God . It is a great event .

Conscience , the fact that the television [ channel ] has the same conscience in all its programmes , and that the whole is harmonious , is very important . A cause can not be fought for without [ the support of ] television . Besides , DATE we can say that television plays the role of artillery or an air force in the jihad , that is the war for domination of the people ... it would be unthinkable to send a soldier to occupy a hill before those forces had shelled or bombed it . That is why the jihad of DATE can not be waged without television . So , for something so vital , sacrifices must be made . What difference does it make if we sacrifice money ? Death is close to all of us . When everything is dark , after death , if you want something to show you the way , that something is the money you give DATE , with conviction , for FAC . It was to remind you of that that I shared my memories with you .

... That is why , from now on , with that conviction , we will truly make every sacrifice , until it hurts . DATE those who contribute , with conviction , to the supremacy of PERSON [ Allah ] be happy . DATE bless you all , and may He grant PERSON even more success . Greetings . ”

– By a decree of CARDINAL DATE the cabinet ( in which the NORP members formed a majority ) had reorganised TIME in public establishments to make allowances for fasting during DATE . ORG had annulled this decree on the ground that it undermined the principle of secularism .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court observed that it had taken into consideration international human - rights protection instruments , including the Convention . It also referred to the restrictions authorised by the second paragraph of LAW . It pointed out in that context that PERSON ’s leaders and members were using democratic rights and freedoms with a view to replacing the democratic order with a system based on sharia . ORG observed :

“ Democracy is the antithesis of sharia . [ The ] principle [ of secularism ] , which is a sign of civic responsibility , was the impetus which enabled GPE to move on from Ummah [ ümmet – the NORP religious community ] to the nation . With adherence to the principle of secularism , values based on reason and science replaced dogmatic values . ... Persons of different beliefs , desiring to live together , were encouraged to do so by the ORG ’s egalitarian attitude towards them . ... Secularism accelerated civilisation by preventing religion from replacing scientific thought in the ORG ’s activities . It creates a vast environment of civic responsibility and freedom . The philosophy of modernisation of GPE is based on a humanist ideal , namely living in a more human way . Under a secular regime religion , which is a specific social institution , can have no authority over the constitution and governance of the ORG . ... Conferring on the ORG the right to supervise and oversee religious matters can not be regarded as interference contrary to the requirements of democratic society . ... Secularism , which is also the instrument of the transition to democracy , is the philosophical essence of life in GPE . Within a secular ORG religious feelings simply can not be associated with politics , public affairs and legislative provisions . Those are not matters to which religious requirements and thought apply , only scientific data , with consideration for the needs of individuals and societies . ”

ORG held that where a political party pursued activities aimed at bringing the democratic order to an end and used its freedom of expression to issue calls to action to achieve that aim , the LAW and supranational human - rights protection rules authorised its dissolution .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court observed that the public statements of ORG ’s leaders , namely those of Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , had directly engaged ORG responsibility with regard to the constitutionality of its activities . It further observed that the public statements made by MPs Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , and by the mayor of GPE , Mr PERSON , had likewise engaged the party ’s responsibility since it had not reacted to them in any way or sought to distance itself from them , or at least not before the commencement of the dissolution proceedings .

CARDINAL . As an additional penalty , ORG decided to strip PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON of their MP status , in accordance with LAW . It found that these persons , by their words and deeds , had caused ORG dissolution . ORG also banned them for DATE from becoming founding members , ordinary members , leaders or auditors of any other political party , pursuant to LAW .

CARDINAL . Judges PERSON and PERSON expressed dissenting opinions stating , inter alia , that in their view the dissolution of PERSON was not compatible either with the provisions of the LAW or with the caselaw of ORG on the dissolution of political parties . They observed that political parties which did not support the use of violence should be able to take part in political life and that in a pluralist system there should be room for debate about ideas thought to be disturbing or even shocking .
CARDINAL . This judgment was published in ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :

“ GPE is a democratic , secular and social ORG based on the rule of law , respectful of human rights in a spirit of social peace , national solidarity and justice , adhering to the nationalism of PERSON and resting on the fundamental principles set out in the Preamble . ”

“ No amendment may be made or proposed to the provisions of LAW providing that the ORG shall be a republic , the provisions of LAW concerning the characteristics of the LOC or the provisions of LAW . ”
“ Sovereignty resides unconditionally and unreservedly in the nation . ... Sovereign power shall not under any circumstances be delegated to an individual , a group or a social class . ... ”

“ All individuals shall be equal before the law without any distinction based on language , race , colour , sex , political opinion , philosophical beliefs , religion , membership of a religious sect or other similar grounds . ”

“ None of the rights and freedoms referred to in the LAW shall be exercised with a view to undermining the territorial integrity of the ORG and the unity of the nation , jeopardising the existence of ORG , abolishing fundamental rights and freedoms , placing the control of the ORG in the hands of a single individual or group , ensuring the domination of CARDINAL social class over other social classes , introducing discrimination on the grounds of language , race , religion or membership of a religious organisation , or establishing by any other means a ORG political system based on such concepts and opinions . ”

“ No one may exploit or abuse religion , religious feelings or things held sacred by religion in any manner whatsoever with a view to causing the social , economic , political or legal order of the ORG to be based on religious precepts , even if only in part , or for the purpose of securing political or personal interest or influence thereby . ”

“ The constitutions , rule books and activities of political parties shall not be incompatible with the independence of the ORG , the integrity of ORG territory and of the nation , human rights , the principles of equality and the rule of law , national sovereignty or the principles of a democratic , secular republic . No political party may be founded with the aim of advocating and establishing the domination of one social class or group , or a dictatorship in any form whatsoever . ... ”
“ ... The Constitutional Court shall give a final ruling on the dissolution of political parties on an application by ORG at ORG . ”
